definition: down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

sentences.english: China's mammoth economy may be downshifting.
sentences.chinese: 而規模龐大的中國經濟也可能在走下坡路。

sentences.english: It was a natural funnel, pointed directly downhill at Johnstown .
sentences.chinese: 這是一個天然漏斗，指出直接約翰斯敦下坡。

sentences.english: The rest of the way is downhill.
It is easier to fight a downhill battle than attempting to influence change from the bottom up.
sentences.chinese: 打一個下坡仗要比試圖自底向上影響變更要更容易。

sentences.english: After that, it is often downhill.
sentences.chinese: 這之後，就常常是走下坡路了。

sentences.english: Green Tunnel on the way home, very pretty, very cool, and very downhill. Yep, that's me in action!
sentences.chinese: 回家時經過有名的綠色隧道，很美，很涼，很下坡。

sentences.english: Traffic was streaming down the grade, mostly big trucks in the righthand lane.
sentences.chinese: 下坡的路上車流如潮，大卡車大都行駛在右車道上。

sentences.english: They mean that you’re past your best and are now in decline.
sentences.chinese: 這意味着你已經過了你的巔峯時期現在在走下坡路。

sentences.english: Lawn downhill there is a small mountain god tei miu.
sentences.chinese: 大草坪下坡還有一座小小的山神土地廟。

sentences.english: Tourism are down and many hotels are operating in the red.
sentences.chinese: 旅遊業在走下坡路，許多酒店慘淡經營，入不敷出。

sentences.english: The so-called movie queen is going downhill.
sentences.chinese: 那位所謂提電影皇后現已在走下坡路了。

sentences.english: All living areas, on the contrary, open up in a downhill direction towards the forest in the south.
sentences.chinese: 相反地，所有生活區敞向下坡方向，朝向南部樹林。

sentences.english: The customs figures show a steady decline in British trade.
sentences.chinese: 關稅數字表明英國的貿易一直在走下坡路。

sentences.english: Huangshi clothing industry has made brilliant achievements while nowadays is on the decline.
sentences.chinese: 黃石市的服裝業曾經有過輝煌，但如今卻在走下坡路。

sentences.english: In came Atlético, and he soon found himself on the slippery slope again.
sentences.chinese: 然後到馬競技，沒多久他發現自己又走了下坡。

sentences.english: "The downhills definitely took a toll, " he says.

definition: uphill/upslope/to move upwards/to climb a slope
to go round a curve/to turn a corner/fig. a new direction
to turn/to go around a corner
to brake (when driving)/to stop/to switch off/to check (bad habits)/a brake
